reviews.review_msg: Andrew is great, however, the group project is a little unfair, your grade really depends on who you are paired with. I've never gotten below avg grade on any assignment in my four years at SFU, however, no one in my group besides myself wanted to put any effort into the project.

Dr. Wister was an amazing prof for GERO 420. He is very compassionate to his students and gives them many opportunities to succeed and improve in the course. Exams were fair and are easily prepared for if you stay on top of textbook readings and module questions. Readings were quite heavy, but manageable if you're interested in the topic.

He manages to make an online course interesting. Fair marker, straight forward, available when you need him. Cares about his students !! Would definitely take another course with him. Final exam more difficult than the midterm.
Andrew is such a great prof. You can tell his passionate about his course just by the way he teaches and follows up with students for feedback. Definitely recommend him

Dr. Wister was great for GERO 420 online! There are only 3 things you are graded on, midterm, final, and one lit review. He has weekly optional 45 minute lectures, which helps if you have questions about the assigned readings. The tests are entirely based on the textbook. The readings were only one chapter a week from the textbook, which was light.

The weekly chats are very useful in underlining the course material. The class is very interesting and the modules are well organized to go along with the textbook.  Dr. Wister is very passionate about gerontology and seems to care about his students. He is also very quick at grading assignments and provides useful feedback. 10/10 would recommend!

Lectures are done live using Blackboard collaborate; they were buggy and unclear but also unneccessary. I listened to only one and it was only worth it if you have a personal interest in the material. Average marker; easy midterm, LONG paper but with very clear instructions and open topic.

Online . Chats all right, hard to hear, partly the system, also unclear speaking. Double negatives on final exam, but questions clear and fair on midterm. Double negatives difficult for ESL students who may be an A student but have a hard time with the wording of questions. Marking the essay portion stricter on final. Felt bad after MT good mark.

Wister is probably one of the best professors I have had at SFU. He is such a sweet guy and really wants his students to do well. He is extremely fair in marking and a really quick marker. He also gives detailed feedback on essays, which is wonderful. He has a very high interest in the course material and his online chats are super interesting. :D

Dr Wister is very knowledgeable and helpful. He even went out of his way to discuss questions I had about a different Gero class. That just shows how passionate he is about the Gerontology field. I would totally recommend this proff.

Prof. Wister, is passionate about his work and is very informative. I found this class to be very different than others which I have taken over my academic career. This class has changed my mindset by making me think a lot more forward about my future life. This class contains more than academic knowledge, it teaches valuable life lessons.

Prof Wister is very passionate about his work and a very informative professor. The require textbook is written by himself in part with another professor. I found this class differed from most throughout my academic career,as it has changed my mindset and make me think a lot more forward about my life as I age.This course is full of life lessons

Online class. Very helpful. Easy to follow. Very clear instructions. Easy to do well but hard to get an A. Prof is very helpful and quick to respond via email. Textbook is easy to read and quite interesting.
